thread.title: Rand slips towards 14/$ as commodity prices drop | Markets
thread.title_full: Rand slips towards 14/$ as commodity prices drop | Markets | BDlive

author: Andries Mahlangu
title: Rand slips towards 14/$ as commodity prices drop | Markets
text:
Picture: GALLO IMAGES/FOTO24/LOANNA HOFFMAN THE rand weakened towards the R14 to the dollar level in midday trade on Monday amid a renewed drop in prices for metals such as platinum.
The domestic unit strengthened to session highs of R13.8015 to the greenback before subsequently losing ground. The platinum price was off nearly 2% at $929.22 per ounce, near six-year lows
"Today should be another day of large daily ranges with the rand likely to trade anywhere from R13.70 to R14.20 to the dollar depending on who has what order," Standard Bank trader Warrick Butler said.
Itâ€™s a start to what will likely be a risk-intense week for the currency and broader financial markets.
Market participants are awaiting domestic trade data as well as the US non-farm payrolls report. A number of US Federal Reserve members will also be delivering speeches, which will be watched for clues as to when the Fed might raise interest rates.
At 11.56am, the rand was at R13.9404 to the dollar from its previous close of R13.9029.
Against the euro the rand was at R15.5980 from R15.5519 previously and was at R21.2275 against the pound from a previous close of R21.1143.
The euro was at $1.1189 from $1.1188.
